title: Arbil
description: Citadel of Arbil according to Google Maps. The metropolitan see of the Church of the East is often called "of Hazza and Erbil" or "of Adiabene". Hazza seems to be the name of the Province. There is also a village near Arbil with a local tradition of a monks' and bishops' monastery nearby. Fiey claims that it is not sure when the residence moved to Arbil, but since Arbil is already part of the name of the metropolitan see, I (RB) presume that the relocation from Hazza to Arbil happened before the 7th century.

title: Arzan
description: There are two Arzon. Sometimes it is difficult to differ between them. According to Fiey, OCN 53f., there is a Azun of the Persians and a Arzun of the Greek (= Erzurum). This article deals with Arzun of the Persians, the capital of the ancient region of Arzene. The geolocation is estimated according to Fiey, Nisibe 186 and his references to Taylor's map and Taylors description on p. 26.
